website_summaries.verdict: These lightweight gloves are four times stronger than leather.
pros: Superior grip with a snug fit
Great for food preparation or jobs with tools that require complete dexterity
Works well with knives, graters, wood carving tools, and quilting rotary blades
cons: May work well in combination with duller knives, but sharpest knives and mandolin slicers will cut through them

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves to save your fingers
customer_reviews.text: After buying the High quality Hessler very high quality and sharp knives, the safety of my fingers was the biggest concern. So i decided to buy those gloves. They looks good and save you from accidentally cutting yourself. Just a caveat: Don't try to intentionally test them, the knife may poke your gloves or try to life ot tough hot objects. They are not made for handling hot stuff. Decent buy for your cutting needs in kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Geek and Curious

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: I lopped off the end of my thumb last week while cutting sweet potatoes. After regaining consciousness I purchased a pair of these NoCry cut resistance gloves and couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Philip C Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Protected 15 yr-old first time shucker
customer_reviews.text: The gloves gave my fifteen year-old grandson the added confidence to shuck oysters for the first time. He's been eating raw oysters for years and loving them so I ordered some fresh raw oysters form Massachusetts (we live in Houston) for his fifteenth birthday. Up until now he had only dealt with oysters already opened like you get in restaurants. He took to it like a champ after his father showed him how. Thanks NoCry! (After opening three dozen, they will definitely need a good washing!)
customer_reviews.author: Jay Michaels

customer_reviews.title: All woman, no cry...
customer_reviews.text: Just used these gloves with a SHARP mandolin to make razor-thin shallots for a made-from-scratch green bean casserole for the holidays. I'm SO happy I bought these because they WORK exceptionally well! I set my mandolin to the thinnest setting and used these gloves to get the finest thinly cut shallots. Love, love, love this product. They fit like a glove! Hahaha.. puntended. :-) If you're culinary inclined, it's a very practical item to have in your must-have culinary cutlery collection. Oh, and I'm not a bot, not a paid person to rave, I'm a reg gal who just loves to cook. So there. ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Ouch!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves looking for use with my mandoline. What a disappointment. Took out the tip of the middle finger while slicing the first potato for pommes anna. Relegated to the trash can.
customer_reviews.author: Beachmaster

customer_reviews.title: Fit & Prevent Cuts
customer_reviews.text: This NoCry cut resistant glove fits and it works (prevents cuts). She wears them when using knives or our mandolins. I purchased these gloves in green for my wife to use with fruits & vegetables. I previously gave her the orange glove set for use with meats. She hand washes and dries them after each use.
customer_reviews.author: Guy T

customer_reviews.title: I can confidently use my mandolin again!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these after losing a battle with my mandolin slicer and partially cutting off the end of my ring finger (attached photo). I won't use the mandolin again without these gloves! Santa put these in my stocking for Christmas and I used them later that day to thinly slice potatoes with the mandolin for a gratin. I experimented to see if I could cut the glove first before actually using the mandolin again. And, I couldn't cut it!! Yeah! Quick shipping from Amazon and a nice follow-up email from the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Wilhelmina

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution, fit great, works great!
customer_reviews.text: First the reason I bought them. I was using my mandoline slicer (with the guard helper on) and lost the end of my thumb. Yep, that hurt! So I needed to find some cut resistant gloves. I used the chart to get the correct size, and they "fit like a glove ". If you'll pardon the pun. Seriously, I used them immediately and not one nick, slice, cut or nip from my mandoline slicer. These were great, just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Hushpuppy13

customer_reviews.title: Valuable Protection
customer_reviews.text: I like to occasionally carve spoons or ladles for my friends and family. I don't carve often and these gloves protect me from my mistakes that an experienced carver probably would not make. They give me a little extra confidence when I carve and they have saved my hands from several slips that I've made.
customer_reviews.author: call4ed

customer_reviews.title: Not for the butcher
customer_reviews.text: If you work in a butcher shop or meat department skip this and get class 10 cut resistant or chainmail gloves I cut right through this in its first use cutting a top inside round
customer_reviews.author: Nick Turner

customer_reviews.title: If they are cut resistant, then so am I.
customer_reviews.text: They are not cut resistant. As with anything that is simultaneously cheap and meant to act as protective wear, the first thing I did with these was test them. I put them on my chopping block and dragged a knife over one of the gloves, and cut a hole in it with a single smooth pass. Put it this way - if you did what the product image shows, you would cut your hand wide open.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as promise
customer_reviews.text: I have cut my the tips of my fingers in half when chopping veggies which sucks because im vegetarian so i am always in the Er with stitches atleast 6 times a year now i have these babies omg no more fear when peeling a potato or chopping carrots etc
customer_reviews.author: reviews you ca. trust

customer_reviews.title: Great for quilting
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to use when cutting fabric with a rotary cutter. They work really well.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are a step above gardening gloves. I dont trust them.
customer_reviews.author: Do what now?

customer_reviews.title: Holes in 3 days of light use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use at work. I might use them for 30 minutes a day doing prep. Nothing really harsh just cutting different vegetables. Well after 3 days there are already holes in the finger tips. These are cheap as it gets. I had another glove that lasted 6 months. I am not happy with these and will spend more next time for better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Davis

customer_reviews.title: These are great gloves for meal prep!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used these gloves the last two days when peeling and cutting a large butternut squash and then jalapeño peppers. They work great. The squash can be difficult to cut and peel but I felt a lot safer using these gloves. When I cut the jalapeños, I didn’t have to worry about “burning” my hands when cutting up the peppers. I would recommend these gloves. Don’t risk cutting your hands. Get these gloves!
customer_reviews.author: Deedee

customer_reviews.title: I'm not sure if mine were defective, or what ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if mine were defective, or what, but the pointer finger is cut through, only the second time I have used them. They have maybe five minutes of use time, total, and are now totally unusable.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cross

customer_reviews.title: Wood Carvers AVOID!
customer_reviews.text: Not good for wood carving. I was carving towards my left thumb with a chip knife on a piece of bass wood and the grain broke out, causing the knife to run out towards my hand. The blade went straight through into my thumb. If your knives are razor sharp, skip this glove. Thank god I missed all vital parts of my thumb.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Harbin

customer_reviews.title: Confidence with gloves
customer_reviews.text: I use gloves mainly in the kitchen and so far I am very pleased. I have average hands for 135 pound woman and small fits me perfectly. They are snug so you can pick up items easily. I bought them because I recently went on Eliquis As the manufacturer says these gloves do not make you invincible to injury. I still need to be careful but they give me the confidence to do my work in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Jef

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: They fit snug so they make it easy to hold things. Were delivered very quickly. 2 days without prime. EXCELLENT. As for durability i will have to get back to you on that.
customer_reviews.author: Hyspeed

customer_reviews.title: Unlikely a level 5
customer_reviews.text: Cut myself with kitchen knife by accident. These do offer some protection but it seems VERY unlikely that they offer level 5 protection. Level 5 is usually metal mesh, these are probably a 3 and maybe a 4. I wouldn't recommend these for oyster shucking or for use when cutting tough (semi frozen meats) things. If you're cutting vegetables or the like, they will likely protect you.
customer_reviews.author: Pimpernel Sandybanks

customer_reviews.title: Why didn’t I buy them earlier?
customer_reviews.text: Love them! I don’t know why people find them slippery - they are not slippery at all, they allow me to clean fresh fish safely and without any problem, and that thing is as slippery as could be. They are not completely cut proof, as it explained in the pamphlet, you can cut them if you really try, but they do save you from accidental cuts beautifully! Highly recommend! As for the size: I have pretty big alongated hand for a woman and “mefium” a little big for me.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Bolchakova

customer_reviews.title: Good as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Cooking is my primary hobby of vice, and I have been at it for decades. I preface that because I have had to slice items more often than I care to remember, and have nicked fingers and hands over the years. I read several reviews, and my primary concern was size. I have always used Large and sometimes X-large gloves. These gloves are 'stretchy' and when slicing onions, you need to ensure the grip is firm and sturdy. So I ordered a medium size, and it works perfectly. So my recommendation if you are looking for a good tight/snug fit, I would order a size down.
customer_reviews.author: Cecil A. Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Leaves small fibers behind in your food
customer_reviews.text: I first used it to slice eggs. It left numerous fibers that look like small hairs. If it wasn't against the white backdrop.of an egg, you would never have seen it. Since then, I washed it in the washing machine. Haven't cut eggs since then. I'm thinking of buying a pair of extra large vinyl gloves to go over these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: M. Popovich

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are great. My cutting skills have improved because I'm confident I won't end up losing a finger. I'm still careful with a knife of course because they're not cut proof gloves, but they offer enough cut resistance that I'm comfortable. I especially like them when using my mandoline as it is easier to hold whatever I'm cutting plus it isn't as dangerous to my fingers to use anymore. I have small hands and even small gloves are sometimes a bit big, but these gloves fit me perfectly. I actually got these to replace another brand of cut-proof/resistant gloves that are too bulky and too big to use comfortably; these are a huge improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Teasel

customer_reviews.title: Good for daily use, fast shipping.
customer_reviews.text: I have to revise my comments after I really cut it once... And seems it's not that reliable. Attached the picture. From 5 stars to 3. I didn't expect it to be as magical as the ad video but it should be more durable. Just 2 weeks! Small size is the fittest I've ever seen ( but my hands are really small so still little larger). It's good to protect you in daily use (I always slightly hurt my self, almost everyday, but now I won't.) Of course do not expect it's magical, it just made from some fiber material so it can be cut. I think the ad video is exaggerated.
customer_reviews.author: D.E.Fox

customer_reviews.title: Regular gloves- not worth buying
customer_reviews.text: This is just a regular pair of gloves. I’m not sure what makes them more cut resistant than any pair of gloves you have in your house. I used them for the first time today while cutting carrots on a mandolin. The gloves briefly touched the blade because they’re a little bulky, and the blade did tear the fibers of the fabric. So yes, I guess it protected my finger, but I’m probably better off gripping vegetables with a towel. If you really want to use a glove, you might as well just use any set of gloves you have at home.
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Great kitchen gloves!
customer_reviews.text: The gloves were very stretchy and easy to put on. I was able to get a good grip on the veggies I was cutting, including large onions! They were also easy to wash (by hand) and dried quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Regular Guy

customer_reviews.title: Not safe for cutting
customer_reviews.text: I do not believe that “cut resistant” is an accurate description for these gloves. They are like cotton/polyester winter gloves. They did not provide me with any sense of protection to use with my mandolin. Returning immediately and I would not recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: ellokaydee

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is off for me but Customer Service is Great
customer_reviews.text: The material the gloves are made of has protected me from cuts on more than one occasion. I am using rotary tool saws and grinders. I ordered a size M which is my usual glove size. The glove fit great but the fingers are too long. I then purchased the SM and the fingers are still too long. I was contacted by the manufacturer who sent a pair of child-size gloves and gave me a credit for one of the other pairs. The child-size is a smidge small for me but the fingers are not too long. The customer service was very good to me and they really tried to resolve the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth N.

customer_reviews.title: Improves safety & health!
customer_reviews.text: I recommend ordering a size larger than what you would normally wear because they are hard to get on again once they get wet. Obviously, I'm too scared to "try it out with a knife," but I have not suffered any knicks, scrapes or cuts while cleaning a lot of the kitchen equipment since ordering these. I don't do that much knifework, but a lot of my side work and maintenance includes cleaning vent hood grates, cleaning a "conveyer belt" convection oven & innumerable other equipment parts. Things that have a sharp edge. I absolutely recommend these and my employer has no problem reimbursing me for the purchase because it prevents a day off and a ton of Band-Aids!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen M. Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Not cut resistent. They protect you by getting themselves cut instead of your hand.
customer_reviews.text: The very first time I used a mandoline with these, I was being careful not to get cut because that's how I always use a mandoline. But something distracting happened and I glanced up and the thumb of the glove touched the blade. So the good news is there's not a hole in my hand. The bad news is now there's a hole right on the getting pad of the thumb of one glove, and the return window had passed by the time I used them. I guess if I repair the hole I can use them as oven mitts, but I already have a pair like that. Caveat emptor. Wear leather instead.
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: Good cut resistance but requires cleaning after each use
customer_reviews.text: These certainly do prevent cuts from knife edges; I use them primarily with a mandoline. But they are problematic to use in cooking because of the porous and absorbent fabric, somewhat sponge-like. The 'juice' from meats, veggies, and fruit penetrate the fabric and must be washed after each use (I use dish soap). But, again like a sponge, they are slow/difficult to dry completely after washing. I have taken to wearing nitrile gloves over these, but that is probably not convenient for most users.
customer_reviews.author: Steve E. Lansing

customer_reviews.title: Will spare your fingers in a moment of distraction
customer_reviews.text: Although I'm typically against crutches when working in the kitchen, these gloves have become my go-to when I don't feel alert enough to avoid cutting myself. The material is indeed cut resistant (not cut proof though) and will spare your fingers in most accidents. The gloves are comfortable enough and grip enough to allow you to easily hold your produce as you slice. My only negative is that they are porous and absorb liquids quickly. These will need to be washed frequently if used daily, to avoid bacterial growth, which could be a hassle for some users. However, for the occasional user, this is a small price to pay for keeping your fingers intact.
customer_reviews.author: K. R. Schott

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: So far, I do like these gloves. I bought them because I once cut my finger when spiralizing and haven’t used it since, but I will now! Also I have razor sharp knives (new purchase) and I am terrified of cutting myself so I will probably use these on occasion with the knives. I can hand wash these and I bought a medium and they fit very comfortably, not too big. There is a slight stretch which is nice. I almost want to buy an extra pair just to see how they will stand up to my knives but ehhh, I will just have to be careful, they are cut RESISTANT not cut proof! Buy them, you’ll love em.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Not a lot of thought to it, put them on and don't stab
customer_reviews.text: They work fine. I've not dealt with heat resistance much. I did grab a hot chicken to hold and the hot juices did not even slow down getting to my skin. I have used it to hold things while cutting. Their instructions say it's not made to stab into ...don't jab the point into the glove! For slicking, it's fine. I've washed it out over the sink and then just let it dry, That worked. It was what I thought it was, and that great!
customer_reviews.author: Kirk

customer_reviews.title: One and done!
customer_reviews.text: After reading several reviews/horror stores about people slicing their fingers on a mandolin slicer, I bought these gloves to go along with my mandolin slicer for protection. I just used my glove for the first time yesterday and was very disappointed. I did slice my finger on the mandolin and it created a hole in the glove. It was not cut resistant at all; one slice and it was done. These will be returned.
customer_reviews.author: R. E.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, Supple Protection
customer_reviews.text: I do wood carving and a good deal of butchery. These gloves replaced a different Kevlar coated steel mesh glove. I have small hands and the medium fit was good. The knit material feels very comfortable and it has stopped slips with my wood carving knives. I believe that my previous steel mesh gloves were more substantial...but the plastic coating on the palms broke down after a few years and my wood projects all turned out 'blue.' Not gonna happen with these gloves. I might need to be more careful with my Berkel deli-slicer but I never got close to knicking myself with that anyway.
customer_reviews.author: James EllsworthTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: cute
customer_reviews.text: These gloves fit my smaller hands well but they're just knit. I don't see anything 'cut resistant' about them. If I tried to specifically slice my hand with a non-serrated blade, I guess the knit cloth would "resist" that a bit. I was looking for something more thorn & splinter resistant. The advertising photo simulating the knife across the palm of the glove was what made me think they might work.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pyle

customer_reviews.title: Basically useless
customer_reviews.text: This is not worth any amount of money primarily because it doesn’t do what it claims to do in any way. It essentially is an overpriced cotton glove. I could buy a cheap pair of winter gloves and have the same effect. I’ve used these for a few months now and I’m probably going to throw them out. It really offers no benefit for preventing cuts which was the only reason I purchased it. Even for the product review they have it set up to skew reviews. The options are overall, hear resistance, comfort, and easy to clean. It has nothing about cut resistance. Of course the main picture on the only hand shows a knife to the glove.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Smoker

customer_reviews.title: I used them once with my new mandoline slicer and ...
customer_reviews.text: I used them once with my new mandoline slicer and sliced right through the tip of the glove. Luckily my finger didn't reach to the end!
customer_reviews.author: DKK

customer_reviews.title: These gloves are amazing
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time buying these gloves. I bought a pair back in 2018 for the kitchen & they're still going strong. Because of covid I needed access to masks & decided to just make them myself. I'm using a rotary cutter & after a slight mishap realized I could use another pair just for sewing needs. So far so good. I want to add these gloves are cut resistant, not "cut proof". If you end up with a gash in the gloves but not your hand, they did their job. I can't recommend them enough. Great quality & worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Christine C

customer_reviews.title: These are not going to prevent you from cutting yourself.
customer_reviews.text: I was using a standard box cutter when the cutter slipped and nicked my hand, these gloves did absolutely nothing to prevent the blade from cutting deep into my hand. The cut was so deep that I could see my tendon. I'm very lucky that I didn't cut my tendon. Had I done that this company would have been sued for everything they are worth. Do not buy this glove, they are worthless, and after testing them since I cut myself, I was able to shred them as easily as any other cotton glove. This is clearly false advertising. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: MG8T

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Protection
customer_reviews.text: These things are a literal finger saver. I'm not the suavest of choppers, and I've tried finger guards which to me, were awkward, and clumsy. These work perfectly. They're lightweight, but sturdy. I've read complaints from people who have purposely sliced through them to test their durability, and I think that's ridiculous. You're going out of your way to deliberately ruin a product, and then claim it's not good enough. No product, short of steel claws are going to be 100% foolproof. If you TRY to sabatoge them, you will. But for basic, everyday chopping, they work fine, and trust me, I'm a klutz.
customer_reviews.author: Christa

customer_reviews.title: No match for a mandoline
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves to use with my mandoline, as the gripping tool that it comes with is awkward. Put one glove on, started slicing - it immediately got a hole in it. Hmm, I thought, maybe it was already damaged when I got them but I didn't notice. Put the second glove on, and it also immediately got a giant slice in it. It was no better than wearing a winter mitten for protection. If you're looking for cut resistant gloves to use with a mandoline, I recommend looking elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael M

customer_reviews.title: Not safe for using with a Mandolin Cutter
customer_reviews.text: We used these gloves exactly one time to hold vegetables as we ran them through our "Mandolin Cutter". For those unfamiliar a "Mandolin Cutter" is a flat platform with a blade shaped like a V. You run vegetables across it and it slices the vegetable into thin pieces. I was cutting for a grand total of five minutes when the vegetable got pretty close to the bottom. I took it across the mandolin one last time and the edge of the pinky in the glove briefly came in contact with the blade. The blade effortlessly cut through the pinky. Luckily the gloves were a little long for my fingers so my hand narrowly avoided getting cut.
customer_reviews.author: Ineternal

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Torn on third use....cut tip with knife while cutting celery ...a just miss thank God
customer_reviews.author: mastro

customer_reviews.title: No Cry is right...
customer_reviews.text: I just used these with my new mandoline. Never having used one of those before, your gloves rocked. They fit perfectly. I used the chart provided when I ordered. They washed up nicely in the sink after I shredded cabbages to make some sauerkraut. I only needed one, which I hung with a clip to dry. Never having used a mandoline before, I am glad I ordered these. These will be very handy when I process vegetables from my garden in the fall. "No Cry" is right! ;D
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: these are no better than jersey gloves. The yard gloves I purchased at Lowe's are more cut resistant. The gray color and poor photo led me to believe that these were something that they were not. This was a garbage purchase for a pair of gloves That I could have purchased at Lowe's for less than $5
customer_reviews.author: Sprinkler Head

customer_reviews.title: Well I haven't cut myself yet
customer_reviews.text: They're not quite as tightly knit as some other cut-gloves I've had in the past, but they also haven't worn out yet. Not that I'm complaining about a cut glove wearing out in the finger—that's a sign that it stopped the blade which was going to cut me enough times that the glove has worn out and should be replaced. I'm good with it. Update: six or so months later, still haven't cut myself. Makes cleaning my meat slicer and my mandoline (which have sharp blades that are difficult to clean with just tools) stupidly easy.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Ghattas

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: My wife does much of our family cooking (I'm the dish washing guy) and she nicks her fingers from time to time cutting, chopping and dicing. We bought these gloves and are very pleased. They fit well (we have medium size hands and the large size was perfect) and appear well made so they should be with us for a long time. The gloves come with useful instructions and warnings. They do a great job and are cut resistant, but are not, of course, cut proof. I doubt that any glove, even chain mail, could be made cut proof. I'm more inclined to try some cutting, chopping and dicing now that we have these gloves. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Beadles

customer_reviews.title: good protection for what I need
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are for protecting your fingers from accidental slips of the knife and for me when I use the box grater. I grate apples for breakfast and I hit my knuckles on the sharp holes now and then and it hurts and gets blood on the food. They are no good for protection from hot things as far as I can tell. They weren't made for that. They are easy to wash at the sink with a few drops of detergent and a rinse of clear water. I recommend them for light duty use not at the butcher with big sharp knives.
customer_reviews.author: ccas

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves for backpacking and camping
customer_reviews.text: I use these gloves as my standard gloves for camping and hiking. Instead of using the typical synthetic material gloves that you see in REI, etc. I use these because they are almost indestructible. REI-type gloves always end up with holes and cuts in them after a few days of backpacking. My NoCry gloves have yet to even look like they've been worn let alone compromised in any way. An added benefit is that they'll protect your hands if you're using a knife or awl, especially if you're far from medical help.
customer_reviews.author: Pedrovski

customer_reviews.title: This is a great company I had an issue with the gloves and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great company I had an issue with the gloves and they got back to me immediately and solve the problem the customer service was amazing and I will definitely be buying more gloves from them in the future I do recommend them for anybody that owns a restaurant for their employees The sizes do run a little small keep that in mind when you're purchasing I'm very happy with the product thank you guys for taking care of a good customer
customer_reviews.author: ryan austin

customer_reviews.title: cut resistance
customer_reviews.text: Invaluable for peeling potatoes with Swedish style slot peeler. I have skinned my fingers many times with this type of peeler. No more - thanks to these gloves. I wear them whenever I use a sharp knife, especially for fileting where the blade might slip. I just bought another pair to send to my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: hhardwick

customer_reviews.title: Simply not well made – I’ve used these gloves three ...
customer_reviews.text: Simply not well made – I’ve used these gloves three times, 20 minutes max., the sewing between the thumb and index finger is unraveling. The leadership at NoCry immediately responded with an offer to remedy this issue - I deeply appreciated their responsiveness as well as their attitude about standing behind their brand's reputation. I'll give the replacement pair another try - the need for protection isn't optional, mandoline slicers are extremely sharp and these gloves are mandatory. Thanks NoCry - your response was exemplary. I'm now changing my "one star" rating to "three" - I'll change it to "five stars" if the second pair perform as advertised - I'm sure they will.
customer_reviews.author: OUT2SEE

customer_reviews.title: Mixed Feelings
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for someone restoring a hot rod. The first pair cut right through the first day he used them. The tool went right through and cut his hand. I got a replacement. The second pair was hit with a broken blade flying off the tool at high speed - high and hard enough to fracture his hand, but didn't cut through. Maybe it was the difference between a hit and a glancing blow, but with consideration that they are a barrier - not armor - they can work
customer_reviews.author: Jessica S.

customer_reviews.title: Good fitting gloves
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to protect my fingers when I use my mandolin to slice fruits and vegetables that I am planning on dehydrating. I measured my hand based on the diagram on the product information page, and when my gloves arrived, they fit, like a glove! Very light and they don't get in the way when using them. I plan on following the instructions for cleaning them, and will still use common sense and caution when wearing them. Nice product for a great price. Will definitely purchase from this company again when these gloves wear out.
customer_reviews.author: J Gage

customer_reviews.title: Fit well, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Hand measurement instructions were helpful and I received gloves that fit very well. The gloves appear to be well made and washed/rinsed easily. Happily, I have not been particularly stupid with a knife yet, so I don't know how well they would protect my hands in the event of a slip. The insert is funny and gets one's attention. Well done! I think the way to think about these gloves is kind of like a bicycle helmet.
customer_reviews.author: Ed from Maine

customer_reviews.title: Ineffective protection
customer_reviews.text: These gloves feel only a step above knitted mittens. On the first use, I cut off the very tip of one of the fingers - not because it was protecting my fingers, but because it’s a little too long for means got in the way of the knife. The knife cut thru it so easily that I didn’t even know until I saw the fibers in my chopped onions. Because there was no resistance, I don’t think these gloves provide any effective protection.
customer_reviews.author: maihiro

customer_reviews.title: Mandolin anxiety banished.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves remove the anxiety of using my mandolin. The fit was exactly as described. They are comfortable and flexible and while I haven't yet done it, keeping them clean will be a breeze. Drop them in a washing machine and air dry. Actually I just used a bit of Dawn detergent and moved on. If you are working in a kitchen with knives and mandolins and are not using these gloves, then make sure your health insurance is paid up :-)
customer_reviews.author: Lance Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Good product.  Gloves protect your hands from accidental cuts.
customer_reviews.text: I have a new set of very sharp knives so I wanted protection for my fingers when cutting and slicing. Initially I had ordered the wrong size. --I needed a small, not a medium. The seller was very gracious and immediately sent a new set of gloves because the ones I ordered were too big. I think the small would fit most women. I recommended these gloves to my friends and family. I am using these gloves everyday. They are so sturdy, I am sure I will be using them for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Hobbyist

customer_reviews.title: Protects fingers from grater&mandolin
customer_reviews.text: I bought these when I got an electric slicer. Turns out the slicer is perfectly safe but I still wear these gloves to use my grater, Microplane and mandolin. They are light, thin enough that I can comfortably hold food items, and they really do protect my fingers. Great value for money compared to what I saw at Target (same price for only one glove). Granted, I only ever need to wear one glove at a time, but while one is in the wash I use the other one. I have machine-washed them multiple times and they are holding up great. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Sofia Romero

customer_reviews.title: Maybe OK for dull blades. Don't knick into it.
customer_reviews.text: Just Ok. But I cut through the fingertips after about 5 times of using my mandolin slicer. Thought I was being gentle to the gloves. Wanted to protect myself since the slicer is very sharp. I then purchased a stainless steel mesh gloves at 3 x the cost. Happy with that. Not an expert on what level 5 protection is, but it obviously is less than practical in real world use. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: User55

customer_reviews.title: Sliced right through.
customer_reviews.text: Upon receiving these gloves, I put a carrot inside one of the finger slots and lightly pressed my knife onto it and it completely sliced through. After reaching out to the company and receiving my refund for these, all I got regarding an explanation was "if the knife is sharp enough, of course it will cut through" .... I am a professional chef, and my main question is WHO USES DULL KNIVES ON A DAILY BASIS? Of course my knives are sharp. I mean, really? What a joke... The fact that I got my refund is the only reason this has 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: ItsAMeKristigi

customer_reviews.title: no, these are not kevlar gloves
customer_reviews.text: these are not the high strength gloves you find in professional kitchens, although they are clearly trying to imitate those gloves, up to the point of making sure they are listed in amazon’s search engine as “kevlar gloves” despite containing zero kevlar. the material is a flimsy cloth fabric. in other words, this glove is not designed to protect your hands from sharp blades, it was designed to protect your hands from dirt. maybe it can keep your hands warm in the winter. dishonest sales tactics. in a better country this kind of boondoggle would be illegal.
customer_reviews.author: Reggie

customer_reviews.title: Works to protect. Don't push it
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for anyone who is already careful with sharp tools. We all can slip on rare occasions. My knives are kept very sharp and are unforgiving. It is good to have a little extra protection. DO NOT test the gloves by attacking them with your blade, especially if your hands are in them. And I doubt they would be very protective from knife tip punctures. I like that they are ambidextrous and I only need one at a time, so I gave the other to a daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry E

customer_reviews.title: I like these gloves.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a set of these gloves after cutting my left thumb bad enough that it required stitches at the Emergency Room. I followed the sizing directions and the gloves fit perfectly and snuggly (like a glove) sorry. I have not had a slip-up yet were the gloves have saved my hand but I'm confident they could take some punishment. Washing involves throwing them in the washer and letting them air dry. I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: KarpeTech

customer_reviews.title: Protects from accidental cuts
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these when I was gifted a mandoline. Having heard many horror stories from the injuries friends have sustained with a slip while using them, safety was paramount to my concerns when using the mandoline. I've had the mandoline for 8 months now, and the best review I can give for these gloves is that I have sustained exactly zero injuries. At no point have I felt like I was in danger of getting cut, nor have I come close. The grip on the gloves also have allowed me to cut just washed vegetables as well without fear of slipping. This is a must-have if you're using a mandoline!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Roth

customer_reviews.title: Gloves failed instantly...
customer_reviews.text: I used these gloves with a mandoline cutter and the very first time I hit the blade with the gloves, they failed!!! I've included a picture of the glove because I couldn't believe it myself... I lost most of my fingernail and a bit of finger as well assuming these would provide basic protection. So disappointed that I trusted these blindly...
customer_reviews.author: Andy C

customer_reviews.title: Mercy for hands
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cut-resistant gloves at a fantastic price. The Amazon reviews that mention "cheapness" or lack of quality almost always also mention the use of a mandoline. These gloves are "cut resistant," not "cut-proof." No glove will survive unskilled use with a mandoline, especially if you're a moronic dilettante... That aside, these are excellent for shucking and a great price point if you need them in quantity.
customer_reviews.author: Six Blue Monkeys

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Cut Resistant
customer_reviews.text: I'll admit as soon as they arrived I tried them on and took a razor blade to them. They fit perfectly and show no sign of damage from the razor blade. Of course not a lot of pressure was applied, but it was a fresh blade and I used more pressure than it would take to cut skin. They are what they claim. However, they should only be used with motor-free, hand operated tools and are especially suited for the kitchen and crafting.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Upton

customer_reviews.title: Really liked using these!
customer_reviews.text: I am left-handed and have always had problems with knives that are sharpened for use by right-handed users since they can slip while I am cutting and I get cut. I used these gloves while slicing onions and I liked that the material is thin enough to still allow me to grip the onion well but heavy enough to protect my hand from being hurt when the knife slipped. The gloves worked exactly as intended and the sizing chart provided allowed me to receive a pair of gloves that fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Denise M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product! Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: What is there not to like about these? Got these for a family member who cuts themself quite often by accident while cooking or fishing and these have helped a lot to reduce injuries. + Fabric is easy on the skin + Works well for fishing as well + Glove size guide is on point Haven't tried these with heat so I can't provide any reviews on that. I do not recommend getting these to wet as well as it makes the fibers weaker. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Phu L. Tran

customer_reviews.title: Still have my fingers
customer_reviews.text: I have only used them a couple times. I did run the knife across my finger while cutting chicken and I was fine. I do notice that I seem to rely on the gloves for protection more than I should. The only down side is if you plan to wear both at the same time, there is no grip on the palms. Therefore I was unable to safely hold the knife while wearing it without the knife slipping out of my hand.
customer_reviews.author: USMC

customer_reviews.title: Great for sharp knives.
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought some new knives that are the sharpest knives I have ever used. First time I used them, was at my in-laws house and cut my pinky. I still loved the knives so much, I bought them. I cut my finger again, as the top skin of the onion slid back and I sliced my ring finger. We decided to buy these gloves to hopefully help with the injuries. I haven't cut myself yet, although they do tell you that they're not 100% cut proof. You can stick the tip of a knife through the weave of the gloves, I don't intend of stabbing myself, just keeping me from getting cut, to which they have worked wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: A Cut Above The Rest
customer_reviews.text: These are very good and functional cut-resistant gloves.I bought these along with a mandoline for kitchen use. We have only had the time to try them out about 5 times but so far, great. Like that they are washable. Like that they are thin and 'delicate' for picking up items and handling things. As is mentioned in the literature, these are NOT cut-proof ! ! ! These are NOT puncture / stab proof ! ! ! These are designed and manufactured to be an aide in using sharp instruments such as cutting meat, potatoes, etc. and using equipment like a mandoline. The Size Chart is something to use for a good fit.
customer_reviews.author: VN PH CIB TET

customer_reviews.title: Saved many a finger and hand
customer_reviews.text: I use these gloves frequently in the kitchen. Whenever I am using a grater or mandolin they are a great and easy way to assure that I don't accidentally nick or cut my fingers. They go right into the washer and then air dry so easy to clean. I have shared them with several friends and relatives who run into kitchen accidents and this puts and end to cuts and emergency room visits. They are wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Jo Ann Graham

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves
customer_reviews.text: I use the Japanese benriner mandolin frequently and the guard that comes with it just damages whatever you are trying to slice up so I never use it. These gloves are form fitting and do not impede my ability to move my fingers so they work well and protect your hands. Plus the instruction sheet it comes with is worth the cost alone. It's hilarious.
customer_reviews.author: DCChris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for rotary cutting fabric!
customer_reviews.text: So far I've been lucky using my rotary cutters but many other quilters haven't. So I figured it's time to get these gloves before I experience a mishap. They are very comfortable and the fit is perfect. The picture of how to size them is correct. I have large hands and thought I needed the large ( like I do for plastic gloves) but the medium fits perfectly. I'm very pleased with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Susie Q

customer_reviews.title: No Cry Cut Resistant Gloves - Safely saves my knuckles and fingers from getting nicked!
customer_reviews.text: I used the NoCry Cut Resistant Gloves only one time since receiving them last week, so this review is after an initial use. The gloves fit well, as described, and provided that safety buffer between my fingers and the fruit I was peeling and the peeler. They kept me from nicking my own knuckles and fingers, instead of the fruit. I'd buy them again, and recommend them to others. I just washed them with the laundry in cold water, and am air drying them now. They kept their size and shape. Good purchase for me!
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: These really work
customer_reviews.text: Ok this has kept my wife from Grating her finger ends off with our Mircoplanes. Not having swearing, and bleeding in the kitchen, and the lack of that salty copper like taste in the pizza cheese is well well worth the cost of these gloves!!! There was a cute post card in the package with a dinosaur on it.... That was the icing on the non bloody cake! Seriously if you grate or cut yourself frequently in the kitchen, just get a pair of these!
customer_reviews.author: G.Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Best cut resistant gloves at a reasonable price!
customer_reviews.text: Best cut resistant gloves at a reasonable price! I use my knives constantly in the kitchen, on the farm and in the workshop. I also cut myself all the time, not badly, just nicks and minor cuts. I got the cut resistant gloves to avoid the nearly endless nicks and cuts and keep them from getting dirty and infected. These gloves fit snugly without being tight. They do not catch on every edge. I can still feel what I am working on and maintain control of it, even wet. They are machine washable. I cannot recommend these gloves highly enough. I will be buying more for family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: N. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Failed first use
customer_reviews.text: First use of gloves after receiving was to cut a slice of salami on my mandoline slicer. The blade cut through the salami, the glove, and the tip of my index finger. I understand the glove is cut "resistant" not cut "proof". Bottom line is they just don't offer the protection I was looking for. To be fair, I have purchased other products from NO Cry and they have been more than satisfactory. This particular item just isn't one of them.
customer_reviews.author: JCARP

customer_reviews.title: Ahhhh, safety for my fingers!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as they look in the pictures! They fit great and will easily become part of my standard workflow. I have not, thankfully, tested their cut resistance other than poking them lightly with my knife. However, given my dexterity and recent history of bad decisions, a real test will come soon and likely without warning, much like the slice in my finger did about three weeks ago. Picture 1: Sad finger Picture 2: Happy (and safe!) fingers
customer_reviews.author: Chris Weaver

customer_reviews.title: So far, no cuts
customer_reviews.text: After essentially removing my “fingerprint” while cutting vegetables I decided I needed to try something other than “being careful” while chopping. These arrived and at least so far no additional cuts! They are easy to put on, I wash them by leaving them on my hands and using soap and water to clean and then remove to dry. So far, no cuts, fit well, and I am satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Dottie

customer_reviews.title: Kitchen Safety Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I first used these gloves at a community cooking party when slicing apples with a mandoline. Though you still have to take care to avoid the blade, the gloves to provide good protection. I bought some for myself as soon as I got home. Now, a few days later, I got a nice note from the founder of No Cry, making sure I was happy with my purchase, but also giving good guidance on the proper use of the gloves. Considering that I probably missed this in the packaging materials, I thought it quite useful. I'm now going to get myself the puncture proof garden gloves he mentioned. : )
customer_reviews.author: sclairet

customer_reviews.title: It Is What It Is!!
customer_reviews.text: The glove is cut resistant. It is not cut proof. You still must be careful with your knives. A glancing slice will not hurt your skin. These are not chain mail but a glass/ polymer blend that is light and protects from cooking, cutting, fishing, butchering hunting accidents involving knives. If a knife fighter is attacking you, you will still have defensive wounds.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Mine ripped on first use!
customer_reviews.text: Would not buy these gloves again. Almost lost a finger after they ripped when I was cutting cabbage
customer_reviews.author: Clairey

customer_reviews.title: I might save a finger next time
customer_reviews.text: Decided to by these gloves after cutting my hand for the 3rd time. This time was the worst. I live in a small town so the Dr that stitched me up stitched me up the other times also. He's the one that suggested I buy these. Never know they made these. I'll get back and change review after I've used them for awhile and find any change. Like cutting my self again. These are really soft so wonder how they will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: gems of jen

customer_reviews.title: A must have for every kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Whenever my mum cuts her finger or hand, her bleeding wouldn't stop, that's why she has been hesitant to use nice knives over the last few years, which has caused so many problems for her. She has to put more pressure on the knife and her wrist, which over time has caused some pain, but since I bought these gloves for her, she has bought nice, sharp knives, and she is very happy in the kitchen
customer_reviews.author: Armila

customer_reviews.title: No More Owies!!!
customer_reviews.text: I keep my kitchen knives pretty dull so that I have some control if they slip, so I don't cut myself. But I want to use sharper tools and not have to worry about cutting myself. These gloves are the perfect solution. Food prep is faster, and I'm safe from ER visits! I call this a good deal! I also use them with some of my outdoor tools, because they are protection against other cuts too. The gloves are comfy, and I just wash them with soap and water and press the excess out with tea towels and then let hang to dry. Works just fine!
customer_reviews.author: westladyTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Must have kitchen essential
customer_reviews.text: Bought two pair of these for two friends and also purchased a pair for myself. We all love them and feel so much safer while slicing and chopping wet or slick vegetables or meats/chicken/fish. No more slipping. Throw them in a lingerie bag in the washer to clean, then air dry. Very reasonably priced product, very well made and sturdy. Great job! Love this kitchen essential and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Coral Caper

customer_reviews.title: Impressive and quite comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought them primarily for my wife who has chemo induced peripheral neuropathy in her hands to prevent her from cutting herself accidentally while chopping, slicing, etc... when she wants to cook. I ended up buying myself a pair as well as frankly...I'm a klutz. I can personally say they are comfortable, grip food well and breath well. As far as I can tell, they are indeed cut resistant. I'm very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: P. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Not useful.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this gloves were liquid blocked as well, but no. I bought them to cut thin meats and the meat blood went through. It does its job of not cutting off the hands, however you loose the ability to feel what you held in your hands. And to clean them I need to wash in the washing machine. This is not useful for myself. It doesn't fit well either. For me, it was waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: P.Chung

customer_reviews.title: Helpful kitchen glove
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to use with my mandoline. They work so much better than the tool that came with the mandoline handle "piece" I have so much more control over what I'm slicing. They aren't totally impenetrable, I ran a knife across the glove and they are knit so, the material did snag a bit. But all in all a great purchase. Upate: since I wasn't 100% satisfied with this product, the owner of the company reached out to me to provide a replacement pair of gloves at no cost to me! I was very impressed with their customer service and they did everything to make sure I was satisfyed with my purchase, I would definitely recommend purchasing from this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: My husband wishes he had known we had these before he used the mandoline slicer
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use with my new mandoline slicer. My husband got up first Christmas day and proceeded to use the slicer without the gloves. Much blood and wasted produce. Was very excited to learn we had these. Also purchased them for friends. I'm told there are versions of these that are more like the steel mesh you wear when diving with sharks. These are good enough to keep you knuckles safe in a home kitchen. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Bell

customer_reviews.title: keeps me from slicing off another thumb
customer_reviews.text: I'm a seasoned chef of 25 years and nobody is perfect. I recently picked up a Benriner Almond wide mandolin and was slicing frozen steak for an Asian dish I was prepping when my thumb slipped right into the brand new blade slicing the tip off. Now we all know that our hands are our main tools so I decided to pick these up due to the fact that in a kitchen we sometimes are multitasking and out minds are going a million miles. These gloves are perfect. I tested them out slicing frozen steak and purposely slipped and thank God, My thumb was saved. no more stitches. Thanks for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Micah LTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Hoping to save a life!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these gloves for my daughter who was recently put on blood thinners. Obviously, cuts can be extremely dangerous when blood thinners are a factor. Cooking is one of her great joys, so we're hoping these protect her from accidental cuts. She lives alone which exaggerates the danger. These were purchased as a Christmas gift, so she hasn't had a chance to try them out. Thinking positively, I gave them 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: B. S. Humphries

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good gloves
customer_reviews.text: So I ordered those gloves because I'm using Japanese knifes and I often cut my finger ( totally almost losing a finger, I'm sharpening my knifes with the Shapton stones up to 12000 grit ). They are really good gloves. I'm atleast getting saved from cuts now. Not that easy to clean. Each time I use them I gotta wash them in really hot water to kill all bacteria and then put them in the washing machine. Also, they are really slippery when you work with veggies and there are some food types that you barely can hold. They do feel nice and really good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Nagornov
